phrases.usage: Use this phrase to begin your story about a trip.
phrases.example: Last week, I went to the beautiful city of London.

phrases.usage: Use this to mention a specific place you saw there.
phrases.example: I visited the local museum because it was very famous.

phrases.usage: Use this to explain how you moved to your next stop.
phrases.example: Then I walked to the central park to see flowers.

phrases.usage: Use this to tell others which transport you used today.
phrases.example: I took the bus because the weather was very rainy.

phrases.usage: Use this to state what time you returned to home.
phrases.example: I came back at seven o'clock after a long day.

phrases.usage: Use this to explain your midday meal time or location.
phrases.example: I ate lunch at a small cafe with my friends.

phrases.usage: Use this to describe a place with too many people.
phrases.example: It was crowded so we did not stay very long.

phrases.usage: Use this to describe the next activity in your schedule.
phrases.example: After that, I bought some tasty food for my dinner.

keyVocabulary.definition: Making you feel very happy and full of energy.
Needing to rest because you have no more energy.
Very nice, beautiful, or pleasant for a person to experience.
Not interesting at all and making you feel tired.
Full of people or having many things happening at once.
